visits.text: Discovery of Devils Bridge (Dyavolski Most), three-arched stone bridge over the gorges of the Arda River
Walk along the gorges of the Arda River in the Rhodopes
Stroll through the small town of Ardino, starting point to Devils Bridge
Découverte de Devils Bridge (Dyavolski Most), pont de pierre à trois arches sur les gorges de la rivière Arda
Balade le long des gorges de la rivière Arda dans les Rhodopes
Promenade dans la petite ville de Ardino, point de départ vers Devils Bridge

activities.text: Light hiking in the Rhodope Mountains around Devils Bridge
Randonnée légère dans les montagnes des Rhodopes autour de Devils Bridge

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA

visits.text: Visit the Palace and Botanical Garden in Balchik, a piece of heaven on earth and a must-see tourist attraction on the Bulgarian Black Sea coast. This architectural and park complex was created as a summer residence for Romanian Queen Maria starting in 1924.

Explore the villa 'Tenha Yuvah' ('lonely nest') and subsequent buildings including an Orthodox chapel, nymphaeum, Moorish-styled patios, a traditional Revival Period house, and fountains decorated with fine marble medallions depicting mythological characters.
Wander through the botanical garden with its remarkable collection of plants from around the world, including one of Europe's largest collections of cacti and succulents.

activities.text: The romantic palace designed by Italian architects combines with the exotic gardens to create one of the most beautiful settings on the Black Sea coast.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discovery of Bansko, major ski resort located in the Pirin massif
Exploration of Pirin National Park around Bansko
Visit to the glacial lake of Muratovo, in the heart of the Pirin peaks
Découverte de Bansko, grande station de ski située dans le massif du Pirin
Exploration du Parc national du Pirin autour de Bansko
Visite du lac glaciaire de Muratovo, au coeur des sommets du Pirin

Explore Bansko in the Pirin Mountains, famous for its ski resorts but equally impressive for summer hiking. Todorka Peak is home to various ski and snowboard runs while the beautiful Pirin National Park offers dramatic ridgelines and glacial lakes.

Discover one of the wildest parts of Europe as the Pirin Mountains and valleys are home to wolves and bears among other flora and fauna. The national park provides countless hiking trails through pristine wilderness.
Visit Muratovo Lake, one of the jewels of Pirin National Park, or challenge yourself with the hike to Vihren Peak, the third-highest mountain in Bulgaria.

activities.text: Day of skiing or snowboarding on the slopes of Todorka Peak in Bansko (during winter season)
Hike to Mount Vihren, emblematic summit of Pirin
Journée de ski ou snowboard sur les pentes de Todorka Peak à Bansko (en saison d’hiver)
Randonnée vers le mont Vihren, sommet emblématique du Pirin
The area transforms into a winter sports paradise with world-class skiing facilities. Summer visitors can enjoy hiking trails ranging from gentle walks to challenging mountain ascents.

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA
Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Visit Batak Reservoir in the Rhodope Mountains, the third largest reservoir in Bulgaria and hugely popular for outdoor activities. This picturesque body of water surrounded by forested hills and mountains offers pristine nature and stunning views.
Walk through the wooded hills and small hamlets that border the lake
Découverte du réservoir de Batak dans les montagnes des Rhodopes, troisième plus grand lac de retenue de Bulgarie
Balade sur les collines boisées et les petits hameaux qui bordent le lac

The reservoir provides hiking, biking, horse riding, and fishing opportunities. Getting out on the water by kayak or boat trip reveals the full beauty of this mountain setting with small settlements dotting the shore.

activities.text: Outdoor activities around Lake Batak: hiking, cycling, horseback riding, fishing or kayak/boat trips
Activités de plein air autour du lac de Batak : randonnée, vélo, équitation, pêche ou sortie en kayak/bateau
While not one of the most 'iconic' attractions, Batak Reservoir offers authentic Bulgarian mountain scenery away from tourist crowds. The nearest town of Batak lies just five miles from the shore.

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA
Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Marvel at the Belogradchik Rocks, natural phenomena that competed for the title of 8th wonder of the world. These red-colored rock formations start before you reach the town and are best viewed from behind the fortress, where you can see formations resembling a couple embracing.

Explore the impressive Belogradchik Fortress, a large rock-walled stronghold in the Balkan Mountains dating back to Roman times. The large rocky outcrops served as natural defensive walls, making it one of the best-preserved fortresses in Bulgaria.

Discover the town of Belogradchik itself, a popular tourist destination nestled among these extraordinary geological formations. The combination of natural wonders and historical fortification creates a unique landscape.

activities.text: Hiking among the rock formations reveals ever-changing perspectives on these ancient sandstone sculptures. The wind is ever-present as you explore these remarkable natural monuments.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discover the Devils Bridge (Dyavolski Most), a beautiful three-arched stone bridge across the Arda River gorge in the Rhodope Mountains near Ardino. Built between 1515 and 1518 by Bulgarian builder Dimitar, it connected Thrace with the Aegean Sea.
Explore the picturesque valley and Arda River gorge, one of the best natural places in Bulgaria. This hidden gem makes a rewarding destination for those willing to venture off the beaten path.

activities.text: Hiking in the surrounding Rhodope Mountains reveals dramatic landscapes and traditional villages largely untouched by tourism.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discovery of the thermal town of Devin in the Vacha River valley, renowned for its mineral waters
Excursion to the Trigrad gorges, spectacular canyon of the Rhodopes
Visite de la grotte de la Gorge du Diable (Devil’s Throat Cave)
Discovery of Yagodinska cave, one of the most famous in the country
Découverte de la ville thermale de Devin dans la vallée de la rivière Vacha, réputée pour ses eaux minérales
Découverte de la grotte de Yagodinska, l’une des plus célèbres du pays

Explore nearby Trigrad Gorge with its dramatic cliffs, the mysterious Devil's Throat Cave, and the impressive Yagodinska Cave. Devin's location nestled in the mountains makes it one of the most scenic parts of Bulgaria.

Relax in Devin, one of Bulgaria's most popular spa towns in the Vacha River valley. The hot springs, thermal spas and resorts here have been known for their healing properties since antiquity, treating ailments especially related to the skin.

The mineral waters are so renowned that one of Bulgaria's most popular bottled water brands, Devin, is sourced and bottled here. The town offers the perfect combination of wellness and outdoor adventure.

activities.text: Relaxation in the thermal baths and spas of Devin, known since antiquity for their healing properties
Détente dans les thermes et spas de Devin, connus depuis l’Antiquité pour leurs vertus curatives
After hiking in this beautiful region with its gorges, rock formations, caves, forests and rivers, rest your weary feet in the healing waters of a spa or hot spring.

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA
Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Visit the Architectural Ethnographic Complex Etar, the first of its type in Bulgaria founded in 1964 and located 8km south of Gabrovo. The museum features the only and unique collection of old-time water-driven machinery in Bulgaria.

Explore 10 water-driven objects forming one of the richest active technical collections among European open-air museums. All objects remain operational as they were in the past - hence the water wheel became Etar's emblem.
Wander the craftsman trade street with 16 models of Balkan architecture showing the original talent of Revival builders. Artisans demonstrate traditional crafts in authentic workshops.

activities.text: This living museum offers a unique window into Bulgarian traditional life and craftsmanship, with demonstrations of blacksmithing, woodworking, and other traditional trades.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Visit the Ivanovo Rock Churches, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in the valley of the Roussenski Lom River in northeast Bulgaria. This complex of rock-hewn churches, chapels, monasteries and cells developed where the first hermits dug their dwellings during the 12th century.
Admire the 14th-century murals testifying to the exceptional skill of artists belonging to the Tarnovo School of painting. These frescoes rank among the finest examples of medieval Bulgarian art.

Nearby, visit the Sveshtarska Tomb, a 3rd-century BC Thracian tomb discovered in 1982 with unique architectural decor including polychrome half-human, half-plant caryatids. The 10 female figures carved in high relief are the only examples found in Thracian lands.

activities.text: The atmospheric rock-hewn complex reveals how monks lived in harmony with the dramatic landscape, carving their spiritual homes directly into the cliff faces.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Explore Kaliakra, a long narrow headland on the Northern Bulgarian Black Sea Coast with steep vertical cliffs reaching 70 meters down to the sea. This nature reserve allows observation of dolphins, cormorants and pinnipeds in their natural habitat.
Discover the remnants of fortified walls, water mains, baths and residence of the despot Dobrotitsa from the medieval capital of the short-lived principality of Karvuna.
Visit Bolata Cove just to the north, featuring a small sheltered beach at the mouth of a picturesque canyon, also part of the nature reserve.

activities.text: The dramatic cliffs and historic ruins create one of the most atmospheric sites on the Bulgarian coast, where natural beauty meets medieval history.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Marvel at the Madara Rider, a UNESCO World Heritage Site carved into a 100-meter-high cliff near Madara village. This figure of a knight triumphing over a lion was carved when Madara was the principal sacred place of the First Bulgarian Empire before Bulgaria's conversion to Christianity.
Read the inscriptions beside the sculpture telling of events between AD 705 and 801. This unique rock relief is the only such monument from the early medieval period in Europe.

Visit Ovech Fortress near Provadiya, standing on a ship-shaped plateau. Reached via the picturesque Ovech eco-trail with steps cut into the rock, this fortress offers local legends from museum guides, plus archery and spear-throwing activities.

activities.text: The Madara archaeological reserve includes other Thracian, Roman, and medieval remains around this sacred site that served multiple civilizations.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discover Melnik at the heart of Bulgaria's wine region covering over 150,000 acres - the country was once the fourth-largest wine producer in the world. This charming city makes a perfect base for exploring nearby vineyards and wineries.

Marvel at the Melnik Earth Pyramids, sandstone pyramids and obelisks rising out of the foothills and towering 100 meters above the forest. These unique geological formations create a surreal landscape surrounding the town.
Explore the old town with its interesting churches, monastery, and distinctive architecture. The combination of wine culture and natural wonders makes Melnik one of Bulgaria's hidden treasures.

activities.text: Join a wine-tasting tour to sample Bulgarian wines in historic cellars carved into the sandstone. The region is particularly known for its red wines produced from indigenous grape varieties.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Explore Perperikon, one of the most ancient monumental megalithic structures entirely carved into the rocks. Located in the East Rhodope Mountain 20km northeast of Kardzhali, this medieval archaeological complex stands on a clifftop at 470 meters elevation.

Discover the rock city that has been inhabited since ancient times, with the comfortable river valley creating conditions of life for millennia. The site is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Bulgaria, revealing layers of civilization carved directly into the stone.

activities.text: The surrounding valley is strewn with dozens of archaeological sites from various ages, with Perperikon as the center. The dramatic setting overlooking the Perpereshka River valley creates unforgettable views.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discovery of Plovdiv, cultural capital of Bulgaria, one of the oldest cities in Europe
Stroll through the old town of Plovdiv and its cobbled streets lined with ancient houses

Visit the incredible Theater of Philippopolis, constructed in the 90s of the 1st century AD with 28 concentric rows of marble seats surrounding the orchestra. This Roman theater with capacity for 6,000 spectators is still used for events today.
Walk through the creative district of Kapana, cafés and galleries
Découverte de Plovdiv, capitale culturelle de la Bulgarie, l’une des plus anciennes villes d’Europe
Flânerie dans la vieille ville de Plovdiv et ses rues pavées bordées de maisons anciennes
Visite du théâtre romain de Plovdiv (Theater of Philippopolis), toujours utilisé pour des événements
Balade dans le quartier créatif de Kapana, cafés et galeries

Discover Plovdiv, Bulgaria's second largest city and often touted as the oldest continuously inhabited place in Europe. The city sits on the banks of the Maritsa River surrounded by seven hills, like Rome, with history dating back thousands of years.
Explore Plovdiv Old Town with its charming cobbled streets and Renaissance Revival architecture. As European Capital of Culture in 2019, the city is considered Bulgaria's cultural capital.
Climb Nebet Tepe or Bunardzhik Tepe hills for enchanting views over the city and its architectural treasures spanning millennia.

activities.text: Climb one of Plovdiv's hills (Nebet Tepe or Bunardzhik Tepe) for the panoramic view over the city
Montée sur l’une des collines de Plovdiv (Nebet Tepe ou Bunardzhik Tepe) pour la vue panoramique sur la ville
Explore the Kapana suburb, the creative quarter filled with art galleries, cafes, and boutiques. The ancient and modern blend seamlessly in this vibrant cultural hub.

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA
Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Explore Prohodna Cave, one of Bulgaria's most famous and easily accessible caves located near Karlukovo village. This natural rock bridge stretches 262 meters with two entrances - at the small entrance the height reaches 35 meters, while the highest cave vault in Bulgaria at 45 meters awaits at the big entrance.
Look up to see 'The Eyes of God' - two eye-shaped holes in the cave ceiling that have become an iconic Bulgarian landmark and popular photography subject.

activities.text: The trail passes through the entire cave, offering a unique experience of walking through this natural geological wonder.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discovery of Rila National Park and the Seven Rila Lakes sector
Circuit around the Seven Rila Lakes, chain of glacial lakes between 2000 and 2500 m altitude
Excursion to Mount Musala, highest peak in the Balkans (option depending on level)
Découverte du Parc national de Rila et du secteur des Sept Lacs de Rila
Circuit autour des Sept Lacs de Rila, enchaînement de lacs glaciaires entre 2000 et 2500 m d’altitude
Excursion vers le mont Musala, point culminant des Balkans (option selon niveau)

activities.text: Chairlift ascent from Panichishte/chiža Rilski ezera area then alpine hiking
Montée en télésiège depuis la zone de Panichishte/chiža Rilski ezera puis randonnée alpine

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA

visits.text: Visit Rila Monastery (Sveti Ivan Rilski), a UNESCO World Heritage Site founded in 927 AD by the hermit Ivan of Rila who lived in a cave nearby. This is one of the best places to visit in Bulgaria thanks to its tranquil location in the mountainous national park.
Discovery of the main church, monks' residential buildings and the monastery museum
Visite du monastère de Rila (Sveti Ivan Rilski), site UNESCO au coeur du parc naturel du monastère de Rila
Découverte de l’église principale, des bâtiments résidentiels des moines et du musée du monastère

Explore the monastery complex including the church, residential areas for the 60 monks who still live here, and the museum. The building as seen today dates back to the 15th century, with some parts older still, rebuilt between 1834 and 1862 after a devastating fire.

Admire this characteristic example of the Bulgarian Renaissance (18th-19th centuries) which symbolizes the awareness of Slavic cultural identity following centuries of occupation. The monastery played an important role in the spiritual and social life of medieval Bulgaria.

activities.text: Walk in Rila Monastery Natural Park around the monastic complex
Balade dans le parc naturel du monastère de Rila autour du complexe monastique
Walk through the surrounding Rila Monastery Nature Park, one of the largest national parks in Bulgaria. The tranquil mountain setting provides perfect conditions for reflection and photography.

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA
Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Descend into Saeva Dupka Cave, with over 400 meters of natural corridors and halls so impressive it's even used as a venue for concerts. Named after brothers Seyu and Sae who hid inside during the Ottoman invasion.

Witness an impressive array of stalactites and stalagmites formed over millennia. Five main galleries each feature unique geological formations. The caves have been inhabited since at least Roman times.

activities.text: Guided tours reveal the cave's history and geology. The acoustics that make concert performances possible demonstrate the remarkable natural architecture.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Hike the Seven Rila Lakes, a series of glacial lakes staggered between 2,000 and 2,500 meters elevation, one of the most picturesque places to visit in Bulgaria. These interconnected lakes linked by streams and waterfalls rank among Bulgaria's most famous tourist attractions.

Discover each lake named for its unique characteristics: 'The Tear' for its clear waters, 'The Eye' as the deepest at 37.5 meters, 'The Kidney' for its shape, plus The Twins, The Fish Lake, The Trefoil, and The Lower Lake. The highest sits at about 2,500m, the lowest at 2,100m.

activities.text: Take the chairlift from Panichishte resort to conserve energy for the 4-5 hour hike around all lakes. Return by 16:30 if planning to take the chairlift back down.
For experienced mountaineers, consider climbing Musala Peak (2,925m), the highest point in the Balkans, accessible from this region.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Cross the Shipka Pass, a 1,150-meter pass through the Balkan Mountain Range famous for the Battle of Shipka Pass during the Russo-Turkish War of 1877-1878. The Russians with Bulgarian help fought the Ottoman Empire in this strategic location.

Visit the Shipka Monument, a 31.5-meter stone tower erected in 1934 to commemorate the battle. The memorial commands stunning views over the countryside and is a significant site in Bulgarian national history.

Discover the Thracian Tomb of Kazanlak nearby, a UNESCO World Heritage Site dating from the end of the 4th century BC. The tomb's murals representing Thracian burial rituals are Bulgaria's best-preserved artistic masterpieces from the Hellenistic period.

activities.text: Hike the Shipka Pass area for spectacular mountain views. See the historic cannons that played a role in the famous battle.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discovery of Sofia, Bulgarian capital at the crossroads of Roman, medieval, Ottoman and Soviet influences
Visit to Alexander Nevsky Cathedral, symbol of Sofia with its blue and gold domes
Walk through the historic center among medieval churches, Ottoman mosques and Soviet-era buildings

Explore the National Museum of Military History for a journey through Bulgaria's ancient history through to its Soviet days. The museum's comprehensive collections document the country's military heritage across millennia.
Découverte de Sofia, capitale bulgare au croisement des influences romaines, médiévales, ottomanes et soviétiques
Visite de la cathédrale Aleksander Nevski, symbole de Sofia avec ses coupoles bleu et or
Balade dans le centre historique entre églises médiévales, mosquées ottomanes et bâtiments de l’ère soviétique
Visite du Musée national d’histoire militaire retraçant l’histoire de la Bulgarie jusqu’à la période soviétique

Discover Sofia, Bulgaria's capital where you can witness evidence of Roman, Medieval, Ottoman and Soviet past all woven together. This city has a real east-meets-west feel with medieval churches, onion-domed cathedrals and Ottoman mosques standing side by side in fascinating harmony.

Marvel at the Aleksander Nevsky Cathedral, one of Bulgaria's most sacred symbols with its beautiful blue and gold onion domes. This magnificent Orthodox cathedral ranks among the largest Eastern Orthodox churches in the world and serves as the seat of the Bulgarian Patriarch.

Visit Boyana Church on Sofia's outskirts, a UNESCO World Heritage Site consisting of three buildings spanning the 10th to 19th centuries. The frescoes painted in 1259 in the second church make it one of the most important collections of medieval paintings, among the most complete monuments of Eastern European medieval art.

activities.text: Excursion to Mount Vitosha overlooking Sofia for a panorama over the city's rooftops
Excursion au mont Vitosha dominant Sofia pour un panorama sur les toits de la ville

Climb 2,292-meter Mount Vitosha for incredible panoramic views across Sofia's rooftops. The mountain makes an excellent day trip from the city, offering hiking in summer and skiing in winter within easy reach of the capital.

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA
Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discover Varna, Bulgaria's premiere Black Sea resort home to six beautiful sandy beaches as well as excellent bars, restaurants and beautiful parks. This port city is also home to incredible museums and Orthodox churches.

See the 'Gold of Varna' at the Archaeological Museum - a nearly 7,000-year-old jewelry collection from the Chalcolithic Necropolis, the world's oldest processed gold. This treasure has been showcased at the European Parliament in Brussels.
The main city beaches offer swimming, sunbathing, kayaking, boat trips and fishing, while beach bars and restaurants cater to visitors along the shore.

activities.text: Visit Asparukovo beach for a more local experience away from tourist crowds. Varna's combination of ancient treasures, beach culture, and modern amenities makes it one of Bulgaria's best coastal destinations.

days_plan.itin_title: Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores

visits.text: Discovery of Velingrad, major thermal resort of the Rhodopes
Visit to Lake Kleptuza in Velingrad, symbol of the city
Découverte de Velingrad, grande station thermale des Rhodopes
Visite du lac Kleptuza à Velingrad, symbole de la ville

Experience Velingrad, another Rhodope Mountains town famous for its healing waters. Founded in 1948 after unifying several villages, the town now hosts over 90 mineral water springs including the renowned Ladzhene, Kamenitsa, Chepino, Rakitovo and Kostandovo.

Choose from 22 different mineral baths and pools varying in temperature and mineral content. Due to the town's popularity there are three sanitariums and over 60 hotels dedicated to wellness treatments.
Visit Lake Kleptuza, one of the largest karst springs in Bulgaria, where crystal-clear water emerges from underground caverns creating a picturesque lake setting.

activities.text: Bathing in the numerous pools and thermal establishments fed by more than 90 mineral springs
Bains dans les nombreuses piscines et établissements thermaux alimentés par plus de 90 sources minérales
The mineral waters are used to treat and prevent many diseases, drawing visitors from across the country. This is one of Bulgaria's premier wellness destinations.

days_plan.itin_title: 15 MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACES IN BULGARIA
Bulgarian Treasures: Ancient Thracian Sites, Mountain Monasteries & Black Sea Shores
